page.title: 04Methodist Chapels, St. Levan
page.content: {There are two Methodist Chapels}in the parish, both part of the St. Just Circuit, where the Superintendant Minister is based. Another minister lives at St. Buryan.{Treen Chapel is {the oldest built in 1834}from bequests made by a Miss Bathsheba Richards and her brother. It originally held 165 people and at one stage had a gallery. {It is now being renovated, the stones {of the alter wall are being left bare and pointed, highlighting the granite whilst the other walls are plastered. {St. Levan Methodist Chapel, built in {1870,}is a stone building,{the gable {ends,}at 35 feet high,{are high for a {country chapel.}It has a two manual organ, fitted in 1902, reconditioned in 1954. It holds about 250 people but present attendances are small.{A youth {club meets in winter}and{Sunday School forms part of the weekly service.
